summary: David S. Morales was a CIA officer with 25 years of service, including assignments in Europe, Latin America, and East Asia. His official personnel file contains biographic information, employment history, and performance evaluations within the CIA. He received foreign awards and decorations, requiring review and approval for retention. He also had an official cover established within the US Army Staff Group under the MAZE unit, effective July 1971. The documents highlight his long career in the CIA and his involvement in various operations and assignments, as well as the establishment of official cover for him.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly mention David S. Morales's role or significance in the JFK assassination context. The documents focus on his CIA career, awards, and official cover. Further research is needed to determine his involvement, if any, in the JFK assassination.
